channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Regular rubbish dumped, 30th June
item.description:
It's becoming a recurring thing that people will come round to dumping their commercial /household rubbish in our building

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Evering Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leak on pavement, 30th June
item.description:
Further to my last report, this is a two week problem, both you and thames water know about it yet nothing done . May i remind you that in Breaside close just down the road a thames water leak caused a sink hole to occur in there back garden . In 2022 a sink hole opened up in martins Grove that caused weeks and weeks of issues .now your letting weeks of water drain into the ground further up the road yet nothing done. Please bear this in mind as obviously the ground is prone . Its needs to be sorted ASAP really. Don't need a ground collapse as i live in the road too .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leysdown Avenue, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant + extreme speeding / near crashes on Wetherell Road, 30th June
item.description:
Cars speed extremely fast down this road, and near crashes occur daily. This is especially concerning given that children are often playing in the street during the summer months, and many domestic animals also occupy the area. The level of speeding poses.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Louisa Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pile of broken furniture, 30th June
item.description:
A large pile of broken furniture, clothes and general rubbish out front of the council owned hostel. Been there at least a week.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queens Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big crack across the middle of the road., 30th June
item.description:
This crack/sunken part of the road has been there for a number of months and causes excessive vibration when buses and large vehicles go over it and causes noise to the nearby houses which is especially noticeable during the night!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Redriff Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vegetation growing across pavement, 30th June
item.description:
Ivy from gardens growing across pavement - looking at Google Maps I think it may across the boundaries of two properties - one in Princes Avenue and the other in Willett Way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princes Avenue, Poverest, London

item.title: Abandoned vehichle, 30th June
item.description:
This vehicle appears to have been abandoned for several months. Its MOT expired in March, and it shows visible signs of damage. It is blocking access to six private garages (numbers 20 to 30 Whernside Close, SE28), with access from Crowden Way. There are concerns it may be stolen or potentially being used for illegal activity, such as drug storage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whernside Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Trip hazard

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dalston Square, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree overhanging pavement., 30th June
item.description:
Tree was cut back several years ago but is again overhanging pavement at around head height. Pavement is very narrow at this point and railings prevent you moving out to miss the branches.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Denver Close, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several potholes, 30th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ruxley Corner, North Cray, London

item.title: Ref N1940 – Waste Presentation Issues – 55 New North Road – Flat 4, 30th June
item.description:
Regarding CPW Ref N1940 to “The Occupier(s)” at address in New North Road: I am not responsible for the waste shown. This is an ongoing issue. Please confirm if any action is needed from me and advise next steps to avoid association.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): New North Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Water leak, 30th June
item.description:
Water leak on the pavement, has been reported before. Thames water is aware . Been a few weeks now but nothing!!! Next there will be a hosepipe ban yet gallons of water being wasted per day . Come on bexley and thames water , get your fingers out and do what your both being paid for .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leysdown Avenue, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Rubbish collection, 30th June
item.description:
Many large bins 6 to 10 of commercial rubbish are being collected EVERY Tuesday morning by the domestic binmen payed for from our rates this is manifestly unfair please stop this practice the binmen park in Westwood lane car park and empty all the commercial rubbish from the garages in bull alley they contain oil,metal, engine parts, car parts, car panels, etc. it’s totally unacceptable it disgusting to watch when our garden waste collection cost has hugely increased and we domestic rate payers are strictly monitoring re amount and category we put out please end this
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Springfield Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light facing the wrong way, 30th June
item.description:
Main road traffic light has been spun around (the one on the left) it's now facing the side road which already has a traffic light facing towards it (the one on the right) this is very dangerous and needs to be fixed asap thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 267, Walworth Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
